name: J Resort
description: Formerly the Sands Regency, J Resort is Reno's newest casino resort in the heart of the emerging Neon Line District. The $150+ million renovation by Jacobs Entertainment features 833 remodeled rooms across three towers (Aspen, Birch, and Cedar), an upgraded casino floor, original curated art throughout, three restaurants, and the outdoor Glow Plaza festival grounds for year-round entertainment.
shortDescription: Refreshed downtown Reno casino hotel with modern rooms and affordable pricing.

roomTypes.name: Birch Tower King
roomTypes.description: Newly remodeled king room in the Birch Tower with plush pillow-top bed, walk-in shower, HDTV, and views of downtown Reno. Floor-to-ceiling windows, USB charging, coffee maker, refrigerator.

roomTypes.name: Birch Tower Two Queen
roomTypes.description: Two queen-size beds in the Birch Tower with walk-in shower, HDTV, and mountain or city views. Same modern amenities as the king rooms.

roomTypes.name: Aspen Tower King
roomTypes.description: Lavish king room in the Aspen Tower with pillow-top bed, walk-in shower, HDTV, and wet bar. Mountain or downtown views.

roomTypes.name: King Grand Suite
roomTypes.description: Spacious three-room suite with king bed, two full bathrooms, wet bar with barstools, queen sofa sleeper, and dining table seating eight. Sierra Nevada or downtown views. ADA compliant options available.

dining.name: J Paul's Italian Steakhouse
dining.description: Fine dining with contemporary Italian-American flair — antipasti, seafood cold bar, prime steaks, and handmade pastas.

dining.name: Hanna's Table
dining.description: Café classics for breakfast, lunch, and dinner in a cozy, welcoming atmosphere.

dining.name: The Buffet
dining.description: Completely renovated all-you-can-enjoy buffet with diverse entrées and desserts.

faqs.question: What is J Resort's connection to the Sands Regency?
faqs.answer: J Resort is the fully renovated and rebranded former Sands Regency, transformed by Jacobs Entertainment with $150+ million in upgrades including new rooms, restaurants, casino, and art installations.

faqs.question: What is the Neon Line District?
faqs.answer: A multi-billion dollar mixed-use entertainment district being developed along 4th Street west of downtown Reno, with J Resort as the anchor property.

faqs.question: Does J Resort have a pool?
faqs.answer: A rooftop pool and spa complex is part of the Phase 2 expansion. Currently the resort offers a seasonal outdoor pool area (Memorial Day through Labor Day).

faqs.question: Does J Resort offer golf packages?
faqs.answer: Yes — Golf the High Sierra creates custom packages with J Resort lodging and tee times at 20+ Reno-Tahoe courses. Call 888-584-8232.

meta.title: J Resort Reno | Downtown Hotel & Golf Packages
meta.description: Affordable J Resort in downtown Reno. Casino gaming and custom golf packages with 20+ courses.

testimonials.quote: Third year in a row staying at J Resort for our corporate golf outing. Consistency is what matters for group travel and this property delivers every time. Having GTHS handle reservations saves us hours of coordination.
testimonials.author: Rebecca D.

testimonials.quote: J Resort is an ideal spot for a golf getaway in Reno. Close to great courses, good restaurants on-site or nearby, and the rooms have everything you need. GTHS knows exactly which room blocks to reserve for groups.
testimonials.author: Chris W.

testimonials.quote: J Resort exceeded our expectations. The staff was incredibly accommodating with our group of 24 — early breakfast, late checkout, bag storage. Everything GTHS promised about this property was accurate.
testimonials.author: Ryan M.
